Leonie Holmes

Integrative Counsellor

Online counselling in Colchester and surrounding areas

Find out more

Welcome

I provide a warm, trusting, safe and non-judgmental space both online and in person to explore your thoughts and feelings.

Hello, my name is Leonie Holmes and I am a female integrative counsellor in Colchester. I help people to explore their emotions through phone counseling and in person, and support them through their counseling journey. I hope I can help you today, and give you some more information to make those first steps.

Perhaps you are finding life really difficult at the moment in the current climate and the pandemic has brought new challenges? Or perhaps you have been struggling and silently suffering for a long time and you would really like some help? I can assure you I will do my absolute best to put you at ease in our initial contact and help you to feel as supported as I can.

Why Choose Counselling?

  • How often in life are we truly listened to without judgment or opinion? This simple act alone can be incredibly powerful.
  • Do you feel completely misunderstood and wish you could explore the reasons why?
  • Do you feel in constant emotional pain?
  • Do you feel haunted by the past?
  • Do you feel trapped by addiction or self-harm?
  • Are you tired of toxic relationships or repeating the same mistakes over and over again?
  • Do you feel anxious, depressed, confused or full of self-doubt?
  • Would you like to get some clarity on why you feel the way you do, understand yourself better and begin a path to healing and happiness?

Most importantly I would like to understand and help you make sense of all the things that are troubling you.

I am a fully qualified integrative counselor and registered with the British Association of Counselling and Psychotherapy which means I abide by their code of ethics. I have monthly clinical supervision with an experienced accredited supervisor, and hold full insurance as well as an up to date DBS certificate.

I can not fix you or instantly take away your pain, but will help you to put pieces of your jigsaw together and begin the path to healing and happiness.

About me

Through my own personal challenges and struggles I embarked on a counselling journey which became life changing. I found a new way to process emotions, manage past trauma and realized life didn’t have to feel quite so hard every day. I became passionate about helping people with their personal challenges and the power of talking therapies.

So often in life we try to do everything by ourselves, we feel we must ‘stay strong’, or ‘take a positive approach’, that we can’t burden others with our problems…and of course the list goes on. All these limitations and pressures we put upon ourselves only serve to make us feel more isolated and powerless. Even when we are at our rock bottom, we can still be so ashamed and worried of asking for help, and when we do, we don’t always get the responses we really need or deserve.

Counseling gave me the safe space to take those first steps to heal and find a new way of living. I hope it can for you too.

When we speak I want to create an environment in which you feel you are in a safe space to be listened to, understood and accepted for exactly the person you are.

"People only seriously consider change when they feel accepted for exactly who they are." - Carl Rogers

My training and approach

I trained at the Life-force School of Counselling in Colchester and gained a BACP gold accredited Integrative diploma.

I also have a fine Art degree and am very encouraging of clients who like to work creatively or express their emotions through creative work.

I regularly undertake continuing professional development as required by the BACP with a special interest in child hood trauma, Complex PTSD, Addiction and narcissistic abuse.

Integrative counselling combines person centered, CBT and psychodynamic approaches. What that means is that I essentially work from a ‘tool box’ of different approaches which I tailor to your needs and personality. If you would like any extra information about Integrative counseling I would be happy to send you some via email.

Most importantly and ‘jargon’ aside we will work together with what you bring to the session. You won’t be given advice, lectured or told what to do, nor will you be quizzed whilst I sit in front of you with a clipboard. I will ask questions, listen, empathize and I may gently try to explore something you have brought up, but ultimately I respect and take my lead from you

Clients are often surprised when they find counseling is a lot more relaxed than they first thought. In our first session you will decide at the end if you want to work with me. I will be gentle, kind and thoughtful in my approach, and really try to understand what it feels like to be you. I remember what the first counseling session is like and how nerve wracking it can be, therefore I will do my absolute best to help you feel relaxed and comfortable.

Experience

I currently work on the team at Life-force centre for counseling in which I counsel adults only. I also practice online in which I mainly do telephone counselling but can also arrange zoom video, and whatsapp video sessions. Click here to find out more about services I offer.

I have experience working with childhood trauma, physical, emotional and sexual abuse, addictions, domestic abuse, suicidal thoughts, toxic relationships, birth and pregnancy issues, depression and anxiety, eating disorders, sexual issues, stress, and PTSD.

Services and fees

Telephone counselling

I currently offer 50 minute weekly secure and confidential telephone counseling sessions.

This has been a counseling method I have started to use more since the outbreak of Covid 19 and have found the work to be just as effective as face to face sessions.

There are many benefits including:

  • No travel time
  • Counselling can be conducted from the comfort of your own home
  • The therapy can be carried out anyway, whilst on your lunch break at work, in the car or even out on a walk
  • With the recent Covid 19 outbreak many people have been worried and anxious about exposure to the virus, or even have high risk relatives so have to be extra careful. This is where telephone counseling becomes an excellent option for you to choose

After deciding you want to work with me, we would have the session at the same time every week, the work is ongoing but we would review regularly to check you are happy and comfortable with everything. I would require payment into my bank prior to the session and I also have a cancellation policy. I take holiday breaks throughout the year, mostly at Christmas, summer and Easter and always give you lots of warning regarding dates.

Current availability for phone sessions is Thursday day time and I also have some mid week evening appointments.

Please get in contact by phone, text or email. Cost is £35 per session.

Face to face sessions

Please enquire to arrange an appointment in person

I practice from Life-force counselling center in Colchester on a Tuesday every week
